analyzed: bdag gis ba dog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: I will give up all attachments.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will generate the thought of sameness towards all beings.'

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: I will bring all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang /
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang /
translated: In this way, even though I bring all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa,

original: sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pas /
analyzed: sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pas /
translated: no sentient being at all has been brought to complete nirvāṇa.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa bdag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa bdag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: I will understand that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing.

original: bdag gis ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
translated: With a mind that is focused on the unique state of omniscience, I will practice the six perfections.

original: bdag gis chos rtogs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos rtogs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will train in the perfect realization of the way of all phenomena.

original: bdag gis chos kyi tshul gcig tu bsgrub pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos kyi tshul gcig tu bsgrub pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: I will understand the way of accomplishing the single principle of the Dharma.🔽I will begin with the aggregates

original: bdag gis phung po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gis phung po nas brtsams te /
translated: and then

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / @262a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / @262a *//
translated: “I will train in the realization of the perfection of giving, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;🔽I will train in the realization of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar bsgrub pa khong du chud pa la bslab par bya'o; ;bdag gis chos dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su bsgrub par bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed de /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar bsgrub pa khong du chud pa la bslab par bya'o; ;bdag gis chos dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su bsgrub par bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed de /
translated: I will train in the realization of all the infinite dharmas.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, this is the vajra-like thought of the bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: de de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: Abiding in it, the bodhisattva great beings, by means of the non-apprehension of a great mass of sentient beings, will reach the culmination of the great mass of sentient beings.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being should arouse his mind as follows:

original: sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can ji snyed cig sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de dag thams cad sems can de dag gi don du bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can ji snyed cig sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de dag thams cad sems can de dag gi don du bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do //
translated: “For the sake of all those sentient beings in the hells, animal realm, and world of Yama, who experience the feelings of suffering, I will experience all those feelings of suffering for the sake of those sentient beings.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gong du 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gong du 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: And the bodhisattva great being should arouse his mind as follows:

original: bdag gis sems can re re'i don du'ang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por sems can gang yang /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can re re'i don du'ang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por sems can gang yang /
translated: “For the sake of each and every sentient being, I will experience the feelings of suffering for many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du /
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du /
translated: until all those sentient beings have attained parinirvāṇa in the dhātu of no remainder of aggregates.”

original: sems can dmyal @262b ba'i sdug bsngal de dag kyang bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes thabs de lta bus sems can thams cad kyi don du /
analyzed: sems can dmyal @262b ba'i sdug bsngal de dag kyang bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes thabs de lta bus sems can thams cad kyi don du /
translated: With this method, for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du /
analyzed: sems can thams cad phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du /
translated: until all sentient beings have attained complete nirvana in the expanse of nirvana without remainder,

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag thams cad kyang bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag thams cad kyang bdag gis nyams su myong bar bya'o //
translated: I will experience all those sufferings of the hells.

original: de nas gdod bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas gdod bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de /
translated: Then, for my own sake, I will generate roots of virtue,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas byang chub kyi tshogs mang po bsags te /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas byang chub kyi tshogs mang po bsags te /
translated: and after many eons, hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, I will gather the many accumulations for enlightenment,🔽and I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: In this way, you should generate the awakening mind.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: This, Subhuti, is the diamond-like thought of the Bodhisattva, the great being,

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: standing in which the Bodhisattva, the great being, as the foremost of all beings, does not review an ultimate thought.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun mi 'chad par rlabs po che'i sems gang gis sems can thams cad kyi phul du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems rlabs po che bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun mi 'chad par rlabs po che'i sems gang gis sems can thams cad kyi phul du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems rlabs po che bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should produce a thought which is high, a thought which is high in such a way that he becomes the foremost of all beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che ni sems dang po bskyed phyin chad 'dod chags kyi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che ni sems dang po bskyed phyin chad 'dod chags kyi sems mi bskyed /
translated: There the high thought of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is that, from the first thought of enlightenment onwards, he does not produce a thought of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not produce a thought of hatred,

original: gti mug gi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: gti mug gi sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not produce a thought of delusion,

original: gtse ba'i sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: gtse ba'i sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not produce a thought of violence,

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang @263a *//
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang @263a *//
translated: does not produce a thought of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sems kyang mi bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sems kyang mi bskyed pa ste /
translated: and they do not even arouse the mind of awakening.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che'o //
translated: This is the expansive mind of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: des sems can thams cad kyi phul byed kyang; sems rlabs po che des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad kyi phul byed kyang; sems rlabs po che des rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: And even though they are the foremost of all sentient beings, they do not become conceited about that expansive mind.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi bsgul ba'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi bsgul ba'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should have an unshakable mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi bsgul ba ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi bsgul ba ni /
translated: Here, the unshakable mind of the bodhisattva great beings

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed cing /
translated: is to be attentive to the knowledge of all aspects

original: des rlom sems su mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi byed pa ste /
translated: without becoming conceited about it.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi bsgul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi bsgul ba'o //
translated: This is the unshakable mind of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: sems des sems can thams cad kyi phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems des sems can thams cad kyi phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: And with that mind they become the foremost of all sentient beings, but in a way that is not observed.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should arouse a mind of benefit and happiness for all beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i sems ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i sems ni /
translated: “Here, the mind of benefit and happiness of bodhisattva great beings

original: sems can thams cad skyob cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyob cing /
translated: is to protect all beings,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong la /
translated: not to abandon any being,

original: des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: and not to be conceited about that.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i sems te /
translated: “Subhūti, this is the mind of benefit and happiness of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de la gnas shing /
analyzed: de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in it,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: they lead the great mass of beings to the highest—nirvāṇa—

original: rab 'byor / @263b gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rtag tu rgyun mi chad par chos 'dod par bya'o //🔽chos la dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / @263b gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rtag tu rgyun mi chad par chos 'dod par bya'o // chos la dga' bar bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should always and constantly long for the Dharma,🔽delight in the Dharma,

original: chos la mos par bya'o //
analyzed: chos la mos par bya'o //
translated: and be devoted to the Dharma.

original: chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should be diligent in the yoga of devotion to the Dharma.

original: de la chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Dharma?

original: chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste /
translated: It is the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Dharma.

original: de la chos 'dod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos 'dod pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the desire for the Dharma?

original: gang chos de la 'dod cing mos pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos de la 'dod cing mos pa ste /
translated: It is the desire and devotion for that Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the desire for the Dharma.

original: de la chos la dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos la dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is delighting in the Dharma?

original: chos de la dga' zhing mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: chos de la dga' zhing mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: It is delighting in and enjoying that Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called delighting in the Dharma.

original: de la chos la mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos la mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is devotion to the Dharma?

original: gang chos de la yon tan du lta ba ste /
analyzed: gang chos de la yon tan du lta ba ste /
translated: It is the view of the qualities of that Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called devotion to the Dharma.

original: de la chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is being diligent in the yoga of devotion to the Dharma?

original: chos de nyid la bsgom zhing mang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos de nyid la bsgom zhing mang du byed pa ste /
translated: It is meditating on and cultivating that Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la mos pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called being diligent in the yoga of devotion to the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
translated: should, in a great mass of beings, be the foremost by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nang stong pa nyid la gnas /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nang stong pa nyid la gnas / phyi stong pa nyid la gnas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, standing in inner emptiness,🔽standing in outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas /
translated: standing in inner and outer emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la gnas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la gnas te /
translated: up to standing in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du 'gyur bar bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang @264a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du 'gyur bar bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang @264a *//
translated: should be the foremost in a great mass of beings.

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas /
translated: standing in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la gnas te /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la gnas te /
translated: great love, great compassion, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po nges pa'i phul du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: and then, by way of not apprehending anything, transform a great mass of sentient beings into the unsurpassed.”

analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: essential nature is unobservable.🔽The emptiness of essential nature is also unobservable.🔽The emptiness of essential nature is also unobservable.🔽The emptiness of all things should be understood as follows:🔽all things are unobservable.🔽The emptiness of all things is also unobservable.🔽The emptiness of all things is also unobservable.🔽The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics should be understood as follows:🔽intrinsic defining characteristics are unobservable.🔽The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics is also unobservable.🔽The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics is also unobservable.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs su med pa'i phyir /

translated: The emptiness of other entities should be understood as follows:🔽other entities are unobservable.🔽The emptiness

analyzed: sangs rgyas dmigs su med pa'i phyir; sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du zad do zhes bya bar yang dag par shes te /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //

analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas shing /

analyzed: des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang /

analyzed: theg pa'i mchog la gnas pa 'di zhes bya ba zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ste /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang / chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags pa sgrog cing /

analyzed: dbyangs su brjod pa mdzad do //

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: go cha chen po bgos so zhes bgyi na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /

translated: don the armor of the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, don the armor of the transcendent perfection of tolerance, don the armor of the transcendent perfection of perseverance, don the armor of the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and don the armor of the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos / phyi stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: They don the armor of the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽don the armor of the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: don the armor of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: and don the armor of the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms @290a *//
translated: He has donned the armor of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
analyzed: par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
translated: the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi go cha bgos /

translated: He has donned the armor of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He has donned the armor of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
translated: Having donned the armor of the Buddha’s body,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
translated: he filled this world system of a billion worlds with light.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi phye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so //🔽lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi phye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so // lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
translated: He filled with light as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so //
translated: In the same way, he filled with light as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in each of the southern, western, and northern directions, in the intermediate directions to the northeast, southeast, southwest, and northwest, below and above,🔽and in each of the ten directions.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
translated: He caused this world system of a billion worlds to shake in six ways.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
translated: He caused as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River to shake in six ways.

original: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs @290b kyi phyogs re re zhing /
analyzed: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs @290b kyi phyogs re re zhing /
translated: in each of the directions,
